definition: not to know one's place
(negative prefix)/not/no
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: In the skills of driving, Mz and winnie are neck and neck.
sentences.chinese: 论开车技术，麦克和维尼那真是不分上下。

sentences.english: In the skills of driving, Xiao Li and Xiao Wang are neck andneck.
sentences.chinese: 论开车技术，不李和小王那真是不分上下。

sentences.english: In the skills of driving, they are neck and neck.
sentences.chinese: 论开车技术，这两人真是不分上下。

sentences.english: Thanks, but it was neck and neck between Tom and me for a while.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢，不过有一阵子汤姆和我实在是不分上下。

sentences.english: Currently they are neck and neck in the race.
sentences.chinese: 目前它们在这场比赛中不分上下。

sentences.english: In the skills of driving, Xiao Li or Xiao Wang are not neck or neck.
sentences.chinese: 论开车技能，不李和小王那真是不分上下。

sentences.english: They are neck and neck at English.
sentences.chinese: 在方面，他们是不分上下。

sentences.english: Most runners are running neck and neck.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的赛跑选手不分上下。

sentences.english: Two shuttle between the mountains, the contest is not divided.
sentences.chinese: 两人穿梭于山林之间，较量不分上下。

definition: lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
equally matched/about the same
to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of
well-matched/equally matched
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
almost on a par
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
slightly better/a cut above
hard to untie, hard to separate (idiom); inextricably involved/locked in battle
evenly matched (idiom)
to become caught up in an irresolvable situation (idiom)
not inferior in any respect
two remarkable persons living at the same period (as 周瑜[Zhou1 Yu2] and 諸葛亮|诸葛亮[Zhu1 ge3 Liang4])
at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
